original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)🔽24.22. Saraṇaduka, Piṭṭhiduka
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  saraṇaduka piṭṭhiduka
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions for the Doctrines in Reverse Order🔽The Twos

original: 24.22.1. Sauttarapada
analyzed: sa auttarapada
translated: The Backs🔽The Further Terms

original: 24.22.1.1–6. Paṭiccādivāra🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saraṇo dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naaraṇaṁ nanadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na saraṇam na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca saraṇaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na araṇam na na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka
translated: The Section on Direct Relations, etc.🔽With the condition of a non-returner’s state that is to be abandoned by seeing, there arises a returner’s state that is to be abandoned by seeing. (In brief.) With respect to cause, there is one … With respect to non-obstruction, there is one.🔽With the condition of a non-returner’s state that is to be abandoned by development, there arises a non-returner’s state that is to be abandoned by development. (In brief.) With respect to cause, there is one … With respect to non-obstruction, there is one.

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na saraṇam na sauttaram dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ sauttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With the condition of a non-returner’s state that is without higher fetters, there arises a returner’s state that is with higher fetters. (In brief.) With respect to cause, there is one … With respect to non-obstruction, there is one.

original: (Sahajātavārampi paccayavārampi nissayavārampi saṁsaṭṭhavārampi sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi paccaya vārampi nissaya vārampi sa saṭṭha vārampi sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on direct relations, the section on conditions, the section on relations by way of dependence, the section on relations by association, and the section on relations by concomitance are similar to the section on relations by condition.)

original: 24.22.1.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: 24.22.1.7. The section on questions

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa🔽Nasaraṇo nasauttaro dhammo araṇassa sauttarassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa  na saraṇaḥ na sauttaraḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa sauttarassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ eka
translated: Cause and object🔽A non-taint that is not supreme is a condition, as cause condition, for a non-taint that is supreme … (one) …

original: Nasaraṇo nasauttaro dhammo araṇassa sauttarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na saraṇaḥ na sauttaraḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa sauttarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ eka
translated: A non-taint that is not supreme is a condition, as object condition, for a non-taint that is supreme … (one) … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe eka adhipatiyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka
translated: As cause: (one) … As object: (one) … As predominance: (one) … (In detail.) As non-hindrance: (one) …

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Nasaraṇo nasauttaro dhammo araṇassa sauttarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: na saraṇaḥ na sauttaraḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa sauttarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-taint that is not supreme is a condition, as object condition, for a non-taint that is supreme …

original: … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… noavigate ekaṁ.🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ  na hetuyāḥ eka na ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe no avigate eka  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: … as co-nascence condition … as support condition … as post-nascence condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽As not cause: (one) … As not object: (one) … (In detail.) As not non-hindrance: (one) …🔽As cause condition, as not object: (one) … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: As not cause condition, as object: (one) … (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvāram evam
translated: (The section on questions should be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: 24.22.2. Anuttarapada
analyzed: an uttara pada
translated: 24.22.2. The Supramundane Factors

original: Hetu-anantara🔽Nasaraṇaṁ naanuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā araṇo anuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetu anantara  na saraṇam na anuttaram dhammam paccayā araṇaḥ anuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: The Condition Being Causal Facilitation🔽A supramundane factor that is not a causal facilitation condition is related to a supramundane factor that is a non-conflict condition by way of the condition being causal facilitation. (In brief.) As the cause, one … As the non-adverting, one.

original: Nasaraṇo naanuttaro dhammo araṇassa anuttarassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye dve, purejāte
analyzed: na saraṇaḥ na anuttaraḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa anuttarassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  saṅkhitta anantare eka samanantare eka nissaye eka upanissaye dve purejāte
translated: A supramundane factor that is not a causal facilitation condition is related to a supramundane factor that is a non-conflict condition by way of the condition being immediately prior.

original: ekaṁ, āsevane ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, natthiyā ekaṁ, vigate ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: eka āsevane eka vippayutte eka atthiyāḥ eka natthiyāḥ eka vigate eka avigate eka
translated: (In brief.) As the immediately prior, one … As the object, one … As the condition being kamma, one … As the condition being nutriment, one … As the condition being a footing, one … As the condition being a road, one … As the condition being a sphere, one … As the condition being a dependence, one … As the condition being a presence, one … As the condition being an absence, one … As the condition being disappearance, one … As the condition being non-disappearance, one.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Nasaraṇo naanuttaro dhammo araṇassa anuttarassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra  na saraṇaḥ na anuttaraḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa anuttarassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The Reversal of the Method🔽A supramundane factor that is not a causal facilitation condition is related to a supramundane factor that is a non-conflict condition by way of the condition being prenascence.

original: Naaraṇo naanuttaro dhammo araṇassa anuttarassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na araṇaḥ na anuttaraḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa anuttarassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A supramundane factor that is not a non-conflict condition is related to a supramundane factor that is a non-conflict condition by way of the condition being prenascence.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe dve …pe… naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte dve …pe… noavigate dve.
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe dve pe na upanissaye eka na purejāte dve pe no avigate dve
translated: With non-cause as condition, there are two. With non-object as condition, there are two. … With non-decisive support as condition, there is one. With non-pre-nascence as condition, there are two. … With non-non-contention as condition, there are two.

original: Upanissayapaccayā nahetuyā dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upanissaya paccayā na hetuyā dve
translated: With decisive support as condition, there are two. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā upanissaye dve, purejāte ekaṁ …pe… atthiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā upanissaye dve purejāte ekam pe atthiyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With non-cause as condition, there are two. With non-decisive support as condition, there is one. … With presence as condition, there is one. … With non-non-contention as condition, there is one. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvāram evam
translated: (The section is to be expanded as in the case of the three triads of the wholesome.)🔽The exposition is in thirty consecutive sections, from the two dyads in the forward order up to the end.

original: Anulomadukatikapaṭṭhānato paṭṭhāya yāva pariyosānā tiṁsamattehi bhāṇavārehi paṭṭhānaṁ.🔽Dhammapaccanīyānulome dukadukapaṭṭhānaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽Paccanīyānulomapaṭṭhānaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma duka tika paṭṭhānataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva pariyosānā ti samattehi bhāṇavārehi paṭṭhāna  dhamma paccanīya anulome duka duka paṭṭhānam niṭṭhita  paccanīya anuloma paṭṭhānam niṭṭhita
translated: The exposition in the reverse order of the dyads in the two triads of ideas is finished.🔽The exposition in the forward order of the dyads in the two triads of ideas is finished.

original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇam niṭṭhita
translated: The exposition of the dyads is finished.
